review.itemreviewed: Benton Springs Fleece Jacket - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great warm fleece for winters In Tennessee. Thin enough I can still safely buckle my daughter into her car seat but warm enough she’s comfortable when we get out of the car or playing outside. Does run small. Definately size up. My only regret is not buying one sooner. Columbia does it again :)

review.itemreviewed: Benton Springs Fleece Jacket - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We love the basic Columbia fleece jackets! We buy them for the whole family and each of us always has one available for fall or spring weather. This is the 3rd one we’ve had for my daughter and she’s always happy to wear them.

review.itemreviewed: Benton Springs Fleece Jacket - Toddler Girls'

review.itemreviewed: Benton Springs Fleece Jacket - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought for my little one’s pink and purples and they  love it, very soft material and comfortable!!

review.itemreviewed: Benton Springs Fleece Jacket - Toddler Girls'

review.itemreviewed: Benton Springs Fleece Jacket - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My youngest loves this jacket! I got her a jacket to match her sister, so that started off on a good foot! But on top of it, she loves the softness and the zipper! I think both my kids have some sensory issues, so the softness of this jacket is necessary! They also love the purple! I love that the have all sizes so I could go to the kids section and get the exact same one for my oldest!

review.itemreviewed: Benton Springs Fleece Jacket - Toddler Girls'

review.reviewBody:
There's no way these are petite/short. I have to cuff them twice to be the proper length, which looks really silly. (I'm 5'2" and ordered the Large "Short".) 

Otherwise a good fit and comfortable. They sit at a normal place on the waist, over the hips, not right at the bum line like a lot of women's pants. Adjustable tabs keep the fit right and the snow out of my back. Ample room in the thighs (also so hard to find!) for good movement. I don't feel restricted in my movements.
review.name: Comfy, but too long

review.reviewBody: Seem like good pants. First pair were too large. Second pair fit well. Looking forward to trying them in the snow.
review.name: Looking forward to trying them in the snow.

review.reviewBody: Arrived in good order but the size is so huge, 2 of me can fit in! I had used an existing OR hiking pants as size guide. Did not work! Can easily go down 2 size. Yep, its that huge.
review.name: Size way too big

review.reviewBody: Comfy, fits as expected. I'm 5'6 and between 130-140lbs and a small fit well. With the adjustable straps someone 10-15lbs smaller could easily fit. Someone slightly bigger than that would be comfy in a medium. This is not super curve friendly just fyi! I have bigger than average curves so there's a small bump in fabric right above the butt, however it wouldn't be noticeable if I was skiing so I'm not all the concerned. If you're very curvy, I would try another item.
review.name: Comfy and cute! Not great for curves.

review.reviewBody: Great fit-love the option of short size so I finally don't have to roll up my pants or have them dragging on the ground. Nice warm insulation but doesn't feel not too thick. I like the zipper openings for ventilation. Good amount of pockets and loops for a belt. Love the color too! Overall terrific pants, and I'm looking forward to years of great use.
review.name: Perfect Pants for Skiing

review.reviewBody: Warm with room in the hips and thighs for movement. Actually true to size. I wear a medium in street clothes and can wear a medium in these. In other brands I have to size up and then they're too loose in the waist. These are great! The tall length is wonderful as I'm a hair under 6 ft.
review.name: True to size with room to move

review.reviewBody: Bought a pair in a different color for a recent trip and bought these while still on the trip because I loved them so much! Great fit and super comfortable. Kept me warm and dry in fresh powder at about 20 degrees. I'm 5'5 and about 135 lbs and ordered a medium. They're a little big but adjustable with the cinching waist. Happy with the size I got.
review.name: Love these pants

review.reviewBody: I bought these for resort skiing and have been happy with the amount of warmth they provide for in bounds skiing. I appreciate the vents in case the day gets warmers as well. They were a little more snug with my layers than I anticipated but overall happy with the purchase.
review.name: Warm and comfy insulated pants

review.reviewBody: Great ski pants, fit me perfectly. Got an XS and I'm 5'3" and 115 lb. Length as perfect. I'm usually a size 26 in pants.
review.name: Dry and warm

review.reviewBody: I haven't ridden a lift yet with these pants but I've worn them twice on a couple of different ski-area uphill outings. They are super comfortable and a great piece of gear for providing a transition from climbing to skiing down. I also like how soft they are.
review.name: Uphill and downhill, great fit

name: Snowcrew Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: Well priced, extremely comfortable and light. Great for wearing by the pool up the river or at the Beach.
review.name: Comfortable light slip on sandles

review.reviewBody:
Living in the Caribbean means I spend more time barefoot than shod, but when shoes are necessary, the Merrell Hydro Moc is my go-to. Calling it a water shoe feels like underselling it—this thing is the Swiss Army knife of island footwear.

Let’s start with the obvious: it looks like something out of a sci-fi movie, and I love it for that. The Hydro Moc embraces its weirdness with open arms—bold, unapologetic, and impossible to ignore. Kind of like island life itself. But these aren’t just for show. Slide them on, and you’ll discover a shoe that’s equal parts hug and workhorse.

Around the house, they’re a dream. Quick to slip on for a stroll to the deck or an impromptu dash to grab laundry before the next tropical squall. At the beach, they’re unbeatable. Walking over hot sand? Easy. Navigating rocky entries to the water? Child’s play. They grip wet surfaces like a pro and laugh in the face of sharp coral. And when I’m done rinsing off post-paddle session, they’re dry before I’ve even unpacked my gear.

The ventilated design is the unsung hero here—goodbye, soggy feet. It drains water instantly and keeps sand from stowing away inside. Perfect for bouncing between kiteboarding sessions, standup paddle adventures, and the inevitable moments when I forget something crucial back at the house.

They’re also lightweight enough that I’ve started tossing them in my bag for impromptu boat days. Need to wade ashore from the dinghy? The Hydro Moc’s got you covered. Tackling slippery docks or uneven trails? No problem.

And let’s be real—on an island where “laid-back” is a way of life, these shoes fit right in. Funky, functional, and fantastically versatile, they don’t just keep up; they set the pace. The Hydro Moc isn’t just a water shoe—it’s an essential part of my Caribbean toolkit. Practicality has never looked so cool.

So, if you’re dreaming of island life or living it like me, do yourself a favor: get a pair. Then thank me when you realize one pair just isn’t enough.
review.name: Island Life, One Step at a Time

review.reviewBody: Way more comfortable than anticipated. First time on wore in Kauai, great.Wearing them on a road trip around SE USA. Driving, short hikes, walks. Love em
review.name: Better

review.reviewBody: Awesome comfort - been wearing them all over including camping in VT last week
review.name: Great comfortable show

review.reviewBody: This fit nicely, can hardly tell I have them on.  However, you need to wear them with socks, as they tend to pickup trash when walking.   The are bad on beach, as sand just fills up the front.   They are not nearly as tough as crocks.  The bottom wears smooths at 2 years, where I have 10 year old crocs that sill have to same texture on the bottom.   But with socks,  they are very comfy.
Most comfortable, rugged and lite weight shoes you can own. I’ve walked miles in these shoes. As a trucker, they touch many bases for me. Great shoe! Great product.
review.name: Great Shoe

review.reviewBody: I like the design and idea of these shoes for summer aquatic activities, and I love my similar Hydro Slides. But the top and side edges of the heel cup dug in and rubbed the skin raw in 3 places on each ankle within minutes the first time I actually put them to use. Also because I had to half-size up, they weren't quite snug enough and the moment they got wet I was slipping and sliding around inside them, making them very unstable. I had only tested them walking around the house when I first got them onsale out of season, so the first time I tried them in the field and discovered these massive problems, it was too late to return. A disappointing waste of money.
review.name: As an Instant Blister Machine, It's Perfect

review.reviewBody: If you like stones in your shoes, blisters and wearing through soles in a few weeks then these are the shoes for you. 5/5 for slipping on factor, 1/5 for everything else.
review.name: Great for picking up stones

review.reviewBody: The most comfortable wet shoes I’ve worn,have had other brands previously but these are the best, good grip on slippery surfaces and great comfort.
review.name: Best ever wet shoes

review.reviewBody: Purchased these for travel and they have become my favorite daily wear shoes. Went to Portugal and Aruba this summer and took my usual four pairs of shoes- both trips the Hydro Mocs stayed on my feet and the others stayed in my suitcase!! Perfect for beach, driving (feet stay cool) and walking on ask types of surfaces. Love them so much that I’m afraid I’m going to wear them out so I’m buying a back up pair! This past week with all the rain they have been a great choice for puddles too! Water just flows through.
review.name: All time favorite

name: Hydro Moc Water Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
The quality seems to be fine, size is ok for cup C, but the material is so thick that I start sweating as soon as I put it on. Support level is ok but not athletic level. 
It would cost me more money to return it. So $7 down the drain :)
review.name: Sweaty bra

review.reviewBody:
These were listed at such a great deal, I couldn't pass up the opportunity to try them.
Based off the size chart I would be a large (36 band, 42 bust) and I did order that size, but I could have definitely sized down. The material is super soft and the elastic band doesn't dig in. Like one of the previous reviews,  it does have a weird gap, under the armpits and isn't as supportive as I was hoping.

I solved the issue by throwing it in the dryer for a little bit and now it works perfectly! But if you have a larger bust,  it will definitely provide coverage
review.name: Comfy but non supprtive

review.reviewBody: I love this concept of a sweatshirt cut into a bra and it looks really really cool. However, the fit is strange in that the fabric under the armpits is very loose and doesn't do my chest area justice. I have a moderate bust but it kinda gets lost in all the loose fabric. If I had gone down a size it would've been too tight around my ribcage. So if you're looking for support and cleavage, I would opt out of this. But if you're after comfort and coverage, go for it!
review.name: Cute but not the best fit

review.reviewBody: Best shorts I have ever owned. Comfortable and has back zip pocket.
review.name: Cross 5"

review.reviewBody: They are nice shorts. It might have been my mistake for ordering a medium. These were super tight and unwearable. I returned them.
review.name: Tight Fit
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody:
I own both the Sense and the Cross 5´ shorts and they look and fit great. The Sense are more comfortable (inner lining, elastic waistband vs drawcords) and the fabric is more breathable. So, if you don’t carry much and run in a hot climate, spend a little more and get the sense.

J’ai les Sense et les Cross et les deux modèles sont beaux et agréables à porter pour courir. Les Sense par contre sont plus confortables au niveau du sous-vêtement interne, de la taille (élastique vs cordons) et le tissu est plus doux et respirants. Donc, si vous n’utilisez pas les shorts pour transporter des choses et que vous courez dans des températures plutôt chaudes, je pense que ça vaut la peine dépenser un peu plus our le modèle Sense.

Male 5´10 70 kg and the medium fit good. August 2024
review.name: Good but the Sense are better

review.reviewBody: Very light and soft shorts, it does not cause discomfort when exercising, and the length is perfect. I like it.
review.name: Soft and Light

review.reviewBody: Seems Salomon changed the design once again, although this time not as drastic. The older model was my favorite running shorts, then came the next gen a few years ago, and now this one. Although the changes are not as drastic, one main change is that these are even shorter, about 1.5 inches shorter than the last pair I bought about a year ago. Logos are larger and the waistband seems just slightly smaller (or maybe the black makes it seem smaller). These shorts are closer to a 3" short and I wish I had bought the 7" which might be closer to the original 5". Pictures show new shorts versus those purchased a year ago. Just seems like my Grande coffee keeps getting smaller. Just don't do it to shorts. If you list it as a 5" short, make it 5 inches. On the fence if I will return these. Pretty frustrating.
review.name: Keeps Changing for the Worse

review.reviewBody: I really like them great shorts fits and look good
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: Very nice shorts, i use them for races, and they fit perfect
review.name: Best shorts

review.reviewBody: I like the shorts just didn’t realize only had a pocket in the rear which is useless for anything you don’t want to get sweaty. I have a similar pair from last year that at least has a small side pocket to put my car keys in. Hat is just fine, needed something to keep the sun off the noggin.
review.name: Shorts/hat

review.reviewBody: Good fit, comfortable for long run and good pocket placement and size
review.name: Good shorts

review.reviewBody: Size guide said medium. They fitted very tight. Sent them back. Material is good though.
review.name: Way too tight

We pass your message on to our designers so that they can take them into consideration in the development of our future products.

review.reviewBody: Slide down my arms while going down the chunky stuff, really annoying and scratchy. I measured and ordered the suggested size
review.name: they slide down my arms

review.reviewBody:
No silicone grip. Say tight I thought it would stay, actually uncomfortable to wear. I have a number of hot elbow armor and need a cooler summer set. 
I like the O'Neal better, even though the protection is smaller in area and thickness, and maybe in response to impact.
Makes my arms feel like a over stuffed sausage.
I have the P.I. Elevate knee and like them. They have silicone grippers and stay fairly well. Fit is not overly tight in the size large knee pad/armor.
review.name: Good D30. Does not stay, too to tight

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love the Elevate Elbow Guard just as much as I love the Elevate Knee Guard. Five stars for high quality construction and great padding. But unlike the Knee Guard, the Elbow Guard has material, not a cutout, inside the elbow where it bends, which bunches and restricts bending movement. Loses a star for that design. Even worse, there are no grippers on the elastic! Loses another star and causes a lot of swearing to come out of my mouth as the guards slip down one or the other arm while I?m navigating the bike park. I am a solid size small in all other Pearl Izumi arm/leg warmers and in the Elevate knee guards but this size small isn?t quite right. Since I?ve already used the elbow guards a bunch of times I am keeping them, but please Pearl Izumi come out with a v2.0 that fixes these deficiencies.
review.name: Well made but not quite right

name: Elevate ElbowGuard

description: Buy the Blenders Eyewear Halo Polarized Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Halo Polarized Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the Blenders Eyewear Halo Polarized Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I don’t generally buy very high-end or very cheap sunglasses, but rather products like Ray Ban or Persol that are a step or two higher than these in quality and construction. I decided to order these on the 2024 Holiday sale, and I’m definitely glad I didn’t purchase at full price. While significantly cheaper than the brands I previously mentioned, even at full price, I can’t see myself wearing these and know they’ll just end up chucked in a junk drawer or center console. The QC was poor - the adhesive sticker wrapped around the frame was not done so squarely and caused the adhesive to transfer to the lenses while folded in the case. No permanent damage but I feel I shouldn’t have to clean adhesive off of my lenses before using the product. The arms of the glasses feature small cone shaped ferrules where they meet the temple tips - on the pair I received one of these ferrules is loose and slides up and down the arm and rattles around while wearing. I could not hand-press these parts together, and shouldn’t have to try. I bought these as my girlfriend has enjoyed a few pairs of blenders acetate frames, but I’m underwhelmed by the feel, style, and construction of these. I will say that a hard case is a nice addition to a ~$60 pair of sunglasses, but I would’ve gladly given that up for better overall quality
review.name: Cheap sunglasses

name: Halo Polarized Sunglasses

review.reviewBody:
I bought this coat from Backcountry & it is gone. Size M fits my 5’8” frame fine. It is comfortable.
I bought it first directly from The Great though & it arrived with broken parts. Contacted the company. They offered a ‘send it back then we’ll send you another one after we receive this one’ slow exchange but I needed the coat for a trip so I ordered from BackCountry instead (arrived quickly). Asked for a refund from The Great instead. They sent me a label but no refund until they received it. After 24 days they wrote to me to tell me that the label had now ‘expired’ so I could not send it back. I wrote & told them that they had not let me know that it needed to be scanned by X date & it was a defective item so could you please reissue a label? The gal ghosted me. No reply. No help. I tried numerous times over several days. 
Just mean.   You expect an item to be sent to you ‘not broken’ but when they send you their expensive coat and it is broken you expect them to help you. They apparently don’t stand behind their products and they are not very interested in helping you (their customer who has bought many things from them).
review.name: Mean Girl Company

name: The Rover Jacket - Women's

comment:
Hey Thomas 
   Sorry you are having issues with the bag! I will send you a follow up but we can definitely work with you on warrantying the bag.

review.reviewBody: This is a really nice youth bag.  Its warm and full featured.  Comfy.  Warm and the zippers don't stick, even if you try to get them to.  What a perfect product for a young camper.  Water proof enough, light enough, price is about half of what you would expect for something this nice.  Team it up with an R4.7 or higher sleeping matt and you have real 3 season comfort.
review.name: Don't be a dummy, buy this mummy!

review.reviewBody: The bag is warm, nice material inside and out, warm, high loft, compresses pretty well too.  Adult quality that will fit a 5 foot tall child with room to grow a little.  The one thing missing is a DWR spray on coating that makes the bag water resistant.  Everything else is perfect, a bargain at twice the price.
review.name: Perfect with one important exception

name: Mistral Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic - Kids'

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a wonderful sleeping bag to be used during cold temps. Handled single digits well. I used the reactor liner with this bag. I am very impressed with the quality and packability of this version. Would order again!
review.name: This is a wonderful sleeping

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag was super easy to set up. Felt like I was in a cocoon throughout the night. Wish breathability was better. Idk how butterflies survive if thats what it feels like!
review.name: Hefty

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this sleeping bag. I am a side sleeper who likes their feet out. This bag meets these needs and goes with me everywhere I go. I sleep on my left side, the men's version is the way for me.
review.name: Side sleeper in sleep heaven

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a very durable sleeping bag. It also helps keep your body temperature regulated so you’re not cold or super hot. I love the versatility of it and the packability of it.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is warm! It’s down filled. Can accommodate a person up to six feet. You can hook 2 sleeping bags together to make a double sleeper. Light weight. Not as constricting as some other mummy bags. Definitely a great find.
review.name: Warmth and comfort

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I can't wait to use this camping! This is a very nice quality down sleeping bag. It's comfortable and roomy and is rated to keep you warm down to 15 degrees! The down didn't poke through the fabric and the zippers worked nicely. My only issue is that one of zippers seems to need fixed as noted in one of the pictures. I like that it came with both a storage cube so the down doesn't get deflated in storage but it also has a travel bag for your trips!
review.name: Good quality sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super comfortable sleeping bag with a really good design to keep the zipper from breaking. Warm and more comfortable than most. Beautiful color and had multiple bag sizes to choose from.
review.name: Super comfy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit Trek Down Sleeping Bag is really nice!  It’s super lightweight but keeps you warm!  The zippers are a little odd with them over lapping.  It comes with a nice bag to put it in to store away!
review.name: Great lightweight sleeping bag!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The package quality is next to none- the quality of the sleeping bag feels like a sleeping mat built into the sleeping bag.

Also comes with a user manual and a sleeping pouch container to hold the sleeping bag. 

Using it for last 1 month 

3 things that stood out 
1. Feels like I'm sleeping on a could, sleeping bag comes with a comfort padding and not just a bag with cheap/useless materials. 
2. Quality control is superb, company makes sure products are correct and very attention to detail. 
3. Overall the retention of heat is appearant and the product holds to its standard
review.name: Top of the line product that wont disappoint

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is a dream! I'm so excited to use it while camping. Its so soft, extremely lightweight and super warm and comfortable. It has durable zippers and closures.  Opens from the top, side, AND bottom. Which is great for people like me who don't like their feet enclosed. I love down filled and knew right away I was going to fall in love with this sleeping bag. It even has a closure to tighten up around your enclosed head. Complete protection and warmth!
review.name: In love!

name: Trek Sleeping Bag: 0F Down

review.reviewBody:
This review compares the Gore R5 2in1 short to the Gore R7 and Salomon Agile. I chose the Gore R5 because it balanced compression, comfort, and convenience for a range of activities including running, trail run/hike, yoga, and strength/crossfit workouts. It is a good value (especially on sale).

In comparison the Gore R7 was lighter/thinner and had higher quality "finish" (e.g., zippers, ties, pockets, seams). The R7 material and stitching was so much thinner that I worried about durability. Also, the fit of the R7 was slimmer than the same size R5. Lastly, the description for this product says "2 side pockets" but these are really pouches along the waistband - good for gels but not much more.

The Salomon Agile had a 'baggier' cut than either Gore product.
review.name: Good all around shorts

name: R5 2in1 Short - Men's

description: Buy the CAMP USA X-Dream Ice Tool online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: X-Dream Ice Tool
hasVariant.description: Buy the CAMP USA X-Dream Ice Tool online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These are hands down my favorite ice-climbing tools, and I get to play with many options because I run the @iceclimbing feeds on social media. The XDream handle works best for me, and the swing is the best fit for my swing-style. I find that I don't flick much as others at the end of my swing. I keep the tool set up to ice mode for WI4/5 and under. When seconding WI6, dry tooling, or climbing mixed, I have the tool set in the Dry mode. I feel this gives it clearance similar to the Petzl Ergo for bigger, odder features on ice. The Ice setting is similar to Nomic angles and better less steep ice. The interchangeable parts work well, too. I typically always keep one handle with the spike on it, unless I'm drying tooling or steep mixed climbing, then I run the handles without the spikes and change the picks to the mixed pic or drytooling pic. The spike handle comes with the Alpine version, or you can buy it separately. I also removed the third grip as I found it hits the ice often on steeper ice, and I didn't climb hard enough, drytooling for it to be useful to me. Hope that helps. Hit me up on IG if you have questions.
review.name: X Dream Ice Tool - Great tools

name: X-Dream Ice Tool

review.reviewBody: I wear these all summer, even walking 20,000+ steps a day in them on vacation. No blisters, no rubbing, no pain.
review.name: My go-to walking sandal

review.reviewBody: These sandals are so lightweight and comfortable! I love the crisscross straps! They add some style and help secure the shoe in place.
review.name: Comfy & Stylish!

review.reviewBody: I bought sandals in my usual size, but the criss crosses on my left foot ( which is my smaller foot) are too tight. They are starting to stretch and I CAN wear them, but I have had this style before and never had this problem. I am disappointed.
review.name: I would buy this product again, but...

review.reviewBody: 10 fits like an 8.5! I wear a 9.5 so I ordered the 10s because they didn't come in half sizes. These strangled my baby toes. I had two friends who wear 9s try them on (one has high arches). Didn't fit them either. I ended up giving these to my sister who wears a 8.5! My sister and one of my size 9 friends all know their Teva size, and these should have been too big. But no. They destroyed everyone's smallest toe! Booo! This was my first time ordering from Teva. I'll pass.
review.name: Wildly incorrect sizing!

review.reviewBody: My everyday flip flops whether it's hanging out at home, camping, fishing, wherever. I love them
review.name: I would buy these in every color

review.reviewBody: I loved this sandal when you used to make it. It was the Cabo or Lucas? The 10 fit perfectly. I was excited to try it. Once again, I ordered a 10 and I was sent a 10 Wide. I don't have fat feet.
review.name: Wide, loose straps

review.reviewBody: Please make this color combo in wedge. Love your sandals but I need more arch support ;)
review.name: Available in mush wedge?

review.reviewBody: I use to purchase these flip flops almost every year because they were the only ones that fit my narrow feet. Unfortunately, this style flip flop is not as narrow as they use to be and the straps are too loose on my feet. This is why I am returning the flip flops.
review.name: Flip flops are great but too wide for me.

review.reviewBody: I will probably end up donating these to Goodwill. The strap that comes across my little toe on both shoes is in the wrong place for my foot. With the first step I take my little toe pops out and decides it's going to hang out on the wrong side of the strap - unsightly and uncomfortable. I'm just glad I got these on sale, they are not worth the retail price.
review.name: Okay flip flop, had hoped for a better fit.

review.reviewBody: I'm normally a 9.5. My arch, instep, and width are all average. Yet the straps on these sandals are trying to rip my little toe off. My sister normally wears a size 8 and these fit her.
review.name: Strangling my wee baby toe

description: Buy the Atomic Backland Pure Alpine Touring Bindings - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Backland Pure Alpine Touring Bindings - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Atomic Backland Pure Alpine Touring Bindings - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is a classic go-to binding. Fairly lightweight compared to all but the slimmest of skimo bindings. Retention has been predictable and secure. I have crashed with them and they released as expected. Going brakeless saves a good amount of weight and makes things even simpler when transitioning.
review.name: A classic go-to

review.reviewBody:
I've now had 3 seasons on the Backland Binding and it now is my go to binding for most of my touring set ups.   Extremely light, but burly and with really nice retention.  I've skied a lot of high consequence lines, some with mandatory rappels, wrought with ice, and i've always felt extremely confident and stable with these bindings.  They are extremely light and have really nice variability in the risers.                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
 My favorite feature is what I call "quick tour" mode - for most of the touring i do here in the Wasatch, I never really need the "flat" tour level.  So, i usually just flip the first riser down, over the pins, without turning the heel piece.  This does two things - allows for quick transitions at the top and bottom.  I can flip the riser up at the top, stomp down, and rip skins and I'm good to go.  At the bottom, all  you have to do is flip the riser back down and you're ready to skin.    Not needing to turn the heelpiece is clutch, and I do believe this helps the binding keep its retention value longer as you aren't constantly forcing the spring while turning it.                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
 Favorite binding in the weight class!
review.name: One of the best for its weight class

name: Backland Pure Alpine Touring Bindings - 2025

review.reviewBody: I really wanted these boots to be the keeper, but they were instantly uncomfortable where the top of the tongue hit the shin.
review.name: Tight on the tongue

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid Leather GORE-TEX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these boots! Waterproof but lightweight. free ankle movement with plenty of ankle padding and sturdiness.
review.name: Great lightweight hiker

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid Leather GORE-TEX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Like the previous reviewer, the sizing seems to be slightly off, but not by much.  I went up 1/2 a size.  I have found Euro sizing to be more accurate across brands in general where I typically would take a 40, in this case 40.5 fit best.  Ultimately, I did not keep these boots because I was concerned they would not hold up for as long as I would like.  They are very light weight, and seemingly well constructed, but not "burly" enough to hold  up to years of hiking in the mountains of Colorado.  I kept more of a mountaineering boot rather than this hybrid boot.
review.name: Sizing slightly off

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid Leather GORE-TEX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I had contacted La Sportiva prior to purchasing the women's Ultra Raptor II mid leather GTX, and unfortunately, they told me the opposite in terms of sizing.  I wish La Sportiva would be consistent in their lasts and sizing.  I wear a 39.5 Bushido II.  I bought Spire Low and Trail Ridge Low both in 39, but the Spire was half US size too big, whereas the Trail Ridge Low fit perfectly.   I was told the Ultra Raptor II was same last as Spire, so since 39 was half size too large, I bought 38.5.  When I received, them 38.5 was way too small, toe curling too small.  So seems I now need a full size up 39.5, which is the same as the Bushido II.  So, be warned that you may want to guage the sizing of Ultra Raptor II mid leather GTX based on your La Sportiva trail running shoe size, and not your La Sportiva hiking boot/shoe size.  The men's version doesn't seem to have as dramatic of sizing differential as the women's.  Other than that, the boots are just about everything I wanted: leather upper, mid, GTX, sticky rubber, light.  The mid size is more like the Merrell Moab mid's which is lower than many other mid hiking boots, which is what I prefer.
review.name: sizing, sizing, sizing

name: Ultra Raptor II Mid Leather GORE-TEX Hiking Boot - Women's

comment:
Hello there

Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention. I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations. We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: The metal teeth on the sides really grip the snow especially going up and down hill. Putting them on or taking them off is not difficult. Having raised rims rather than a second set of crampons in the rear makes them more maneuverable. The plastic bed is very sturdy and seems almost like metal. The design for women allows for easier walking too. I have small bones and a high arch so I wear sturdy hiking boots and thick socks. There is no reason why they would hurt ones feet with proper footwear. Very pleased with them.
review.name: Smart Engineering

review.reviewBody: The traction on these snowshoes is great. They have helped me get up and down some steep, icy slopes. I am giving them a 2 star review because the bindings are very painful. The front binding puts a huge amount of pressure on 2 small spots on the side of the foot, especially going downhill. I wear insulated heavy duty winter hiking boots, I have tried adjusting them to a variety of foot positions and varying levels of tightness, and yet every time I end up with pain, blisters, even bleeding on the outside of my foot/pinky toe.
review.name: Painful Bindings

review.reviewBody: I received this as a grift for Christmas and wish I would have gotten sooner. Great design and easy to use.
review.name: Easy to use

review.reviewBody: My only complaint would be the front strap, you are on a learning curve on tightening it so you don't put pressure on your toes.
review.name: Decent

review.reviewBody: The bindings bruised the top of my feet, no control when going downhill and worst of all, snow accumulated on the insides of the bindings between the plastic rim and the boot. This is an Epic Fail...!
review.name: Terrible design :(

name: Revo Explore Snowshoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: The opening to put your foot in the boot is too small. I need info on how to return them
review.name: I will return them

review.reviewBody: I hike every day in the woods and I work outside. These are the only boots that I can buy brand new and put on and wear all day and not have my feet hurt. I have no other work shoe for 10 or 15 years. Thanks a lot for your product
review.name: I hike every day in

review.reviewBody: Can’t believe how comfortable this boot is. Great traction, practical and stylish! Does the job in Big Sky, MT!
review.name: Search is over!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am amazed at the ease of taking them off or putting them on after reviewers set they were stiff. They are my new go to shoes in the cold rain or snow!
review.name: Love my boots!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These boots are awesome! Great fit, lightweight and warm. I use them where larger boots prove impractical like running errands and shopping. Slip right on and out the door. . .
review.name: Practical Boots

review.reviewBody: The boots are comfortable, warm, keep my feet dry and have a really good, non-slip sole.
review.name: The boots are comfortable, warm,

review.reviewBody: Last pair lasted me over 3 years of near daily wear in the northern Ohio’s autumn to spring! I’m tough on my gear and these stand the test of time for me. Love em!
review.name: My second pair!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like these boots because they keep my feet warm and dry. My left foot is 1/2 a size larger then my right foot so my left foot is a little tight feeling. You need to offer your customers a special fit for your product? Just a nice thing to make your company stand out from others.
review.name: Great boot and very warm

review.reviewBody:
I think I have bought a half dozen of these boots, about one year off Keen or another retailer. They are good for rain/snow or any weather and pretty durable (everyday wear, including work and play). 

This time I jumped on a sale but the boot had a small bubble in the toe. I emailed a picture and they sent another perfect pair right away. So you can have confidence in Keen!

It’s a good company in my experience and makes quality shoes and stands behind them, too.
review.name: Great Company (You can Trust Keen)

review.reviewBody: My wife has a pair on, loves them, and always wears them in the mountains. I thought I would get a pair to try, and I was very satisfied. Easy to slip on and off. They run a little large for me, but maybe it's just me.
review.name: Great Boots

description: Buy the MSR PocketRocket Deluxe Stove Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: PocketRocket Deluxe Stove Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR PocketRocket Deluxe Stove Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Great bikepacking set but the rubber pad slips down and burns. I ended up throwing it away and doing without it.
FOr the money this costs that level of quality issue really shouldn't happen - sorry :(
review.name: Great little set - BUT.......

review.reviewBody:
I like this set. Wonderfully durable and well used on my wilderness hitches. Has everything I need for big and small meals, coffee, tea, and everything between. Perfect for solo and with a friend too!

Only small two issues. The Pocket Rocket Deluxe doesn't quite fit with an 8oz can of IsoPro so the lid doesn't sit as snug. I tried fitting it and folding it but to no avail. The pot should be a quarter inch deeper. Not a huge ergonomics issue as the mesh bag holds everything right together.

The slightly bigger issue is the rubber insulated grip on the pot. It slides down as the pot heats up. That could be a problem if it melts. Doesn't happen everytime but has happened more than once. I think a small lip in the pot design would prevent it.

Other than these two small issues, I am perfectly happy and supremely satisfied with the function of this kit. Works exactly as I need and haven't had a major problem. Definitely would suggest to purchase to a friend or coworker.
review.name: Excellent with Two Small Issues

review.reviewBody: Love the stove and cook kit set. Looking forward to using on my AT section hike this spring.
review.name: Great Set!

review.reviewBody: Great stove, awesome pot. Overall pretty killer off the shelf system. Wish the lid had a snug fit
review.name: Great stove, awesome pot. Overall

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this little kit! Everything fits right inside the pot, and the pot nests into the bowl. It doesn’t take up as much room as some other stove kits. It’s very light!
review.name: Great stove!

review.reviewBody: So easy to use. I bought it for my daughter after her expereince with my whisper light didn't go so well. She loves the PocketRocket Deluxe. She spent 4 days in Yosemite and said it worked perfectly. And so easy to use. Starts right away.
review.name: College aged Daughter approved.

review.reviewBody: Love the product, but before I use it, is the bottom portion of the Deluxe Stove Kit's container heat protected so I can grab it with my hands? Or is the holder completely necessary?
review.name: Less a review, but a question

review.reviewBody:
Silicone ring expands and falls off the pot and into the flame if you run it at full blast. There is an included slip of paper warning you not to do that in the box, but it's pretty lame that you can't use the full output of the burner with the included pot. 

The burner is excellent on it's own. Just buy that.
review.name: Just buy the stove and a different pot

review.reviewBody: Awesome stove! Boils water so fast yet whole system stows in a one liter pot! Super efficient, love the piezo!!!
review.name: Awesome stove! Boils water so

review.reviewBody:
The stove it self if faultless and is a great addition to lightweight cooking, the igniter fires the stove up instantly with 1 click. The only reason for not giving 5 stars if for the performance of the pot, which like another review had the same issue on a low flame the the insulator ring slid down and started to burn. 

 I think it would be a far better kit with out the insulator ring in the first place and priced cheaper without it. 

Other than that its great
review.name: Great stove, but Insulation ring lets down the pot

name: PocketRocket Deluxe Stove Kit

When I go out for my morning walks in the cold gray morning light all that color makes me happy and these pieces keep me warm!

review.reviewBody: Love the beanie purchased. It is super soft and fits perfectly!
review.name: Love It ❤️

review.reviewBody: Super soft and warm beanie that matches my Trico jacket and is a go to for walks on cool evenings.
review.name: Soft and warm

review.reviewBody: I bought this to wear under my bike helmut when riding back with wet hair from swimming. It works great. Just wish it was just a touch longer on the sides to full cover my ears.
review.name: Nice beanie

review.reviewBody: I have countless beanies and every one, if you were to put them all the way on would cover your eyes, if you put them above your eyes you're left with an empty awkward pooching top. This one actually fits a human head and is super cute.
review.name: Finally a propotioned beanie!

review.reviewBody: Very great for cold temp of 25 30 degrees for 3 or more hours
review.name: Teca fleece beanie

review.reviewBody: This hate fits perfect. I purchased it to match my jacket. I love the beanie.
review.name: Love love love

review.reviewBody: The beanie is well made and felt very warm. But it was a bit too small for my large head. The fleece on the hat makes it so it really doesn't have any "stretch" to it so It was a bit too small for me.
review.name: A bit small for my big head

review.reviewBody: We have size large heads and these one size hats fit great! Great for the Oregon beach and for Mt Hood!
review.name: Fleece cold weather hat

review.reviewBody: Matches the the fleece zip up jacket and coat I bought…also quite warm for how light weight
review.name: Warm and cute

review.reviewBody:
I had an old road helmet that I was riding with. Just bought a new MTB this year and decided to upgrade my gear. After some research I knew unneeded the MIPS technology. 

This helmet is everything you need at the best price point. 

PROS:
Price sweet spot
Lightweight
Great fit
Adjustment wheel makes tightening super easy
Has visor and super safe
Looks great! 

CONS: none

I was gonna get a Troy Lee, but all the other helmets with MIPS are $150 +

Get it!
review.name: Awesome!

name: 4Forty Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: Great style. Great fit. Fades out over time giving a solid worn in look.

review.itemreviewed: PFG Solar Stream Elite Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Been wearing this too Saturday soccer games, sitting in the sun and heat. The fit is more accurate than other Columbia sun hoodies I've had that fit 1-1.5 sizes bigger. I'm 5'10" 200lb and Medium is trim but not snug. I can feel the cooling breeze when my back gets sweaty l. The hood when pulled over a ball cap shields the sides of my face and neck, and isn't too big. It moves with my head so I can see peripherally. The material is less spandex stretchy than other Columbia sun hoodies which also helps with a better fit. Also the material is lighter/thinner than other Columbia Sun hoodies. The "cooling" seems to be mechanical vs chemical (e.g the blue dots on the "ice" products) with little dimples in the fabric that increase surface and moisture movement that will hopefully last longer. The pocket is unnecessary and could be removed in a redesign.
review.name: Best sun hoodie yet!

review.itemreviewed: PFG Solar Stream Elite Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This shirt is light, comfortable, and just feels great when you wear it! I have tons of Columbia shirts. Probably about 40 shirts that constantly get replaced with new and this shirt was worn one time and when I took it off it had 6 places the threads pulled. Very disappointed. I will be returning
review.name: The threads pull easily
comment: We are sorry to hear the quality for this item was not as expected. Please contact our Customer Care support team via phone or chat to see what options are available!

review.itemreviewed: PFG Solar Stream Elite Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fabric of Solar Stream Hoodie. Unfortunately the material snagged considerably
review.name: Material snagged considerably, returning
comment: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback.

review.itemreviewed: PFG Solar Stream Elite Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this shirt in the blue and wore it on backpacking trip -- it kept me from getting sunburned and mosquito bitten so well, that when I returned from my trip, I bought a second one in the mint green.  It breathes so I didnt get too hot and yet as a long sleeve shirt it kept me warm enough in the cool morning. The hood helped cover my face from the mosquitos so that I didnt bitten. Love these shirts!
review.name: Awesome PFG Solar Stream Elite Hoodie

review.itemreviewed: PFG Solar Stream Elite Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought two hooded, long-sleeved shirts for a trip to Mexico. I love this one! The fabric is light, breathable, and quick-drying. The fit was perfect. I normally wear a large in everything and the looseness of this fit allowed it to dry quickly. Thumb loops, stash pocket, and sunglasses wipe are all bonus features!
review.name: Love the fabric and the fit

review.itemreviewed: PFG Solar Stream Elite Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased a Carbon blue PFG Solar Stream hoodie at a Bucc-ee's for sun protection on our Florida trip and it's VERY comfortable.  However, I've only worn this shirt ONE TIME, and already have multiple snags on the front!  I wasn't even doing anything athletic, just sitting around the pool at a rental house when my wife noticed three snags in the material.  I haven't even got a chance to wash it yet!  At this pace, this shirt wouldn't last more than a month.  I'm really not happy with this quality.
review.name: First time wearing it, developed three snags.
comment: We are sorry to hear the quality for this item was not as expected. Please contact our Customer Care support team via phone or chat to see what options are available!

review.itemreviewed: PFG Solar Stream Elite Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] An attractive option for battling intense summer sun.
review.name: Sun Protection

review.itemreviewed: PFG Solar Stream Elite Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This has become my favorite new hoodie, it is so comfortable and fully covers me away from the pesky summer bugs. The wicking is a must today with the heat we face through the next 2 months and I appreciate the sun protection SPF level as well.
review.name: New Fav

review.itemreviewed: PFG Solar Stream Elite Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The material does wick moisture well. It is light enough that it breathes. In terms of sun protection, I'd like it even more if the neck was tighter. This is the only negative on a very good shirt.
review.name: Great sun protection in hot weather.

review.itemreviewed: PFG Solar Stream Elite Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: First impression fits nice and comfortable. About 1 month old with 1 wash… threads are pulling out, zipper is so small and can barely fit a few keys. Also question the sun rating my back was burnt after a few hours in the sun
review.name: Just not worth the price.
comment: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback!

name: PFG Solar Stream Elite Hoodie - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love my blush pink bottle. Very soft pink and neutral. The ceramic is great for cleaning and clean flavor. And the 16 oz size is great for monitoring my hydration
review.name: Perfect travel bottle

review.reviewBody: I loved the bottle until I noticed chipped ceramic coating along the rim of the mouth. It is scary to think that I may have consumed the chipped ceramic in the water! I’ve only had the bottle for a bit over a month, it’s very disappointing!
review.name: Ceramic coating Pilling Off After One Month of Use

review.reviewBody: Because the bottle is ceramic coated, you don't get any metallic taste. The bottle is also durable and lightweight. and keeps drinks hot or cold.
review.name: Best bottle

review.reviewBody: I have used this bottle for years and I love it except for one thing - the lid is IMPOSSIBLE to clean. The dishwasher doesn’t get it clean. Hand washing doesn’t get it clean. Taking out the little rubber gasket and scrubbing under it doesn’t get it clean. Somehow, the lid traps water in the rubber part that screws on to the bottle, which you can’t reach with a brush and means it doesn’t dry. So you get MOLD. It’s disgusting. I am considering buying a new lid because I like this bottle but I don’t want to reward a company for its poor design
review.name: Please fix lid!

review.reviewBody: i own this in cream and pink and i LOVE them, have used them for over 2 years. I have lot of WPs other bottles too. I would love if there was a mint pastel blue color of this!!!! WP has it for their ceramic mug, please make one for this too!!
review.name: PLEASE MAKE A MINT COLOR / PASTEL BLUE COLOR

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Busy emptying my kitchen of all my Yeti and other cups love these
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the look and quality of my ceramic lined insulated bottle. It keeps my tea hot for a long time and best of all there is no aftertaste in the tea. Very pleased with my order and how quickly it arrived. It was not my first time to purchase and won’t be my last.
review.name: Ceramic lined bottle

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A beautiful piece of art that feels very nice in the hand. Maybe it does not insulate as well as a Contigo, but close...
review.name: Beautiful piece

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got the white insulated bottle excited to order 2 more. My partner was trying to get their hands on this cup but I love it. Took it to the beach all day and it kept my drink cool the whole time. The white color looks very sleek
review.name: Very cute. Exactly what I wanted environmentally

review.reviewBody: I am so happy with this bottle. The taste of coffee stays the same and that was the most important part for me. It also stays hot for a long time.
review.name: Love it

name: Insulated Ceramic 20oz Bottle

review.reviewBody:
This saddle if quite different from a normal flat saddle, it took me some time to understand how to take advantage of its design.  It took about 8 months of fiddling with the fore-aft and nose tilt, talking to my fitter, and reading articles about SMP design to get it PERFECT.  Here are some insights I've learned during that time to hopefully accelerate your adjustment of this saddle:
1.  The tilt of the saddle needs to be adapted to your riding position.  The more aggressive your position, the further down the nose needs to be.  The "whale tail," as I'll call it, is designed to tilt your pelvis forward which recreates the curvature of your spine and reduces lower back fatigue and increases pedaling efficiency.  This in turn will relieve pressure from your arms and shoulders.  It's awesome.  If you have a fairly aggressive position, i.e. road race bike with slammed stem, the nose will end up tilted farther down than you would expect.  This saddle really shines with low aggressive positions. 
2.  The saddle is narrower overall so you will naturally sit farther back on it.  This means you will need less setback than most saddles.  Put another way, this saddle needs to be more forward than most other saddles.  You may actually end up with it slammed all the way forward if you have a setback post.
3.  I haven't seen this documented anywhere, but I'm pretty sure the two divots on the whale tail are the intended locations of the ischial tuberosities.  When I sit with my ischial tuberosities on the divots, the saddle distributes pressure perfectly across my bones and my position is completely stable, and also is most effective in angling my pelvis forward.
4.  A lot of reviews I've read describe that there is only one correct position to sit on an SMP saddle due to the curve.  I have found this to be incorrect.  If you have the nose of the saddle tilted downward the correct amount, the curve is designed to accommodate any changes in pelvic angle and natural fore-aft adjustments you will make based on the grade of the climb or descent.
review.name: Absolutely best saddle I've ever ridden

name: Composit Saddle

hasVariant.description: Buy the Western Rise Diversion Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The materials and construction are great. Unfortunately, the sizing is all over the place. If you can guess your size correctly, these would make for a great travel pant.
I ordered my standard 34x30, which fit more like a skinny 32x32 - tight in the waist, and noticeably longer than 30" inseam. Based on other reviews I suspected the 34s would be tight, so I also ordered 36x30. While the waist fit better, the inseam was still noticeably longer than 30" and the crotch sat pretty low. I have a friend who found the right size for him and he loves them, but these are not for me.
review.name: Great Idea, Poor Execution

review.reviewBody: OMG. These are way too tight in the waist and legs. I know they are a slim fit but really? I ordered the correct size but maybe should go a size bigger. I had to return them.  I did think the feel of them was very high quality. If they would have fit better, I'm sure I would have loved them.
review.name: Squeeze It In

review.reviewBody: Love these pants, but just way too slim.  I am also a very slim guy.
review.name: Waaay too tight

review.reviewBody:
I ordered the 30" waist x 32 " inseam.

Seems excellent quality, but they are really tight!  I flt easily into Arc'teryx and La Sportiva 30" waist, so I generally fit into relatively athletic-fit type of pants comfortably. 

Had to return them.
review.name: Tight!

name: Diversion Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I very recently purchased the MSR Whisperlite International and worked so well until the pump stopped working - such a pain! And this happened when I’m about to test the stove for its first mountain expedition. I’m glad that it’s not happening during the trip but unfortunate that I need to find a replacement and it’s difficult to get one where I’m located. So the trip is on hold at this point. Wish you can help.
review.name: Pump-pain

review.reviewBody: This is an issue...... The plastic breaks easily. Please make a pump that can take a little outdoor use... Also please don't say it is not an issue. I had 2 pumps break 1 from just being in a bug out bag.
review.name: Fuel pump broke

review.reviewBody: The MSR Dragonfly stove is an indestructible engineering marvel. The flimsy, fragile plastic pump that goes with it is a piece of junk. This is my third one. The quality disconnect between the pump and the stove is striking. I love the stove; I will just keep buying replacement pumps.
review.name: Stove yes, pump no.

review.reviewBody: Functions well, but not quite as easy to use as the (much) older style. Harder to fit it into the fuel bottle, and more importantly, the old style thumb wheel valve was much more robust and easier to use.
review.name: Functions well, but not quite

review.reviewBody: Pleased to fix and keep my twenty one year old stove working. Pleased that MSR makes good quality gear that is able to be repaired.
review.name: MSR standard fuel pump

review.reviewBody:
Fuel works excellent!! Glad I have it!!

5 Stars!!
review.name: MSR Fuel Pump

review.reviewBody:
Very poor quality pumps at a very high replacement cost. I purchased two different MSR liquid stoves the Dragonfly and the XGK. The legs have broken very quickly on the Dragonfly and both pump have leaked around the connection with the fuel bottle.

Very poor quality equipment at a high end price.
review.name: Fuel Pump & Stove legs

review.reviewBody: The dragonfly stove is indestructible and will never let you down. The plastic pump is junk. I am on my third one. Buy two or three - you will need them in the future. Carry an extra in case yours fails in the middle of a backpacking journey.
review.name: Great stove, terrible pump

review.reviewBody:
Works wonderfully! In 2000, we bought our DragonFly for an extended camping/canoeing trip in Algonquin Provincial Park and it is still going strong! Thrilled that MSR has true replacement parts to keep the DragonFly going and that we don't have to replace with a brand new product. If we ever do, it will definitely be another MSR cook stove which will no doubt outlast us =)
Thank you!
review.name: Works wonderfully! In 2000, we

review.reviewBody: I bought this to replace my original 1994-era pump. The new design is smart, simple and works great. MSR knows how to make good, reliable gear. Highly recommend.
review.name: MSR gear is as good as it comes

name: MSR Fuel Pump

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Long Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am 63 and love to ride long distances, 60-100 miles. Thats my idea of long distance. I would get numb in areas that made riding a distraction. But with these bibs I feel like I'm sitting on my couch. Absolutely amazing. Now a small downside. They feel pretty bulky in the padding area, especially in the butt. BUT, you will forget and forgive because you will be so comfortable. They are not cheap, but they are more comfortable than sitting on cheap ones and having an extra $100 around. Now hopefully they hold up for a long time.
review.name: WOW  comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Long Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've been wearing Assos bib shorts for over 25 years. While expensive, for me they are well worth it and I can almost always purchase them when they go on sale, which is not very often. I recently purchased the Mille GTO C2 long, which are perfect for my style of riding. I'm 5'9", 160 lbs, and the medium fit just right, as recommended by the Assos sizing guide. This is the first pair I have gotten without the mesh back, and I really like them. They're so comfortable I forget I even have them on. It's too early to comment on their durability, but all previous Assos shorts I have purchased have held up very well.
review.name: So comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Long Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Paid $350 for these shorts.  Wore them for two seasons.  Fewer than 1,000 miles per season on the shorts.  The front seam below the belly then came apart.  Assos and the vendor say it is no longer under warranty and cannot be repaired.  The best they can offer is $50 off a full priced replacement.  I’ve been wearing Assos bibs exclusively for over 15 years.  This is not the quality of product or level of service I expect.  I will think twice before purchasing another Assos product.
review.name: Fell apart, Assos didn't care

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Long Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: While comfortable, the bibs wore so thin that, after not much use, they became see through.
review.name: Do not buy

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Long Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my third pair of Mille GTO C2 Longs. Prior to these bibs, almost every ride over 30 miles resulted in abrasion wounds in crotch area. This is despite trying several different high priced bibs, gobs of chamois creme, and a few different saddles. I know I have sensitive skin, but was depressing. Then I read an article about a rider who tried these bibs. He described a situation similar to mine and said these bibs took care of the problem. I tried them and I am a happy camper. I have never had an abrasion sore since, even on my century rides which I do every month. Not even the hottest days have been an issue. It probably has to do with the floating chamois changing the friction dynamics, but whatever it is I am happy to pay the extra $$ for them. I still use chamois creme, but these bibs have been a game changer for me. As a bonus, I am tall so the long version allows me to look a bit less goofy in bibs. 6'4", 182lbs.
review.name: Perfect bibs--no more misery

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Long Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are the tuxedo of Bike shorts! thank you, thank you thank you Assos!!!
review.name: Tuxedo of shorts

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Long Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have owned many brands of bib shorts over the years and Giordana FR-C Pro was my favorite for the last 3 years. The legs and straps were starting to lose elasticity so I splurged and bought the Assos Mille GTO C2 Long. I am 6'1"/138 lbs. and size L fits like a glove. I definitely appreciate the slightly longer legs. The chamois is hands down the most comfortable I've ever ridden with... perfect for long days on the bike. This is the most expensive piece of kit I've ever purchased but my undercarriage certainly appreciates it!
review.name: Best bib shorts I've ever worn

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Long Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve worn this just about every day for a couple of months.  My rides are rarely more than 20 to 30 miles, but in the past I have started to notice and be bothered by other bibs in the past.  These I completely forget I’m wearing.  I’ve ridden with them in temperatures ranging from about 40 to 85 degF.  If riding in cooler weather, I may put something on my knees, but I don’t think I’d feel the need to have a warmer bib unless it became severely cold and windy or wet.  I know these are expensive and hesitated at first, but I have no regrets whatsoever.  They probably saved me buying two or three other pairs I wouldn’t have liked as much.
review.name: Prefect bib

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Long Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Wearing these is like riding around with the best Swiss masseuses, all applying the right amount of compression to keep you riding longer.  Top sheet of the chamois inspired enough confidence to ride sans butter.  The flammeD?Or version look pretty rad to boot.  

Assos? size-finding tool was spot on for me. I?m 6-foot, 190-pounds and Large fits perfectly. 

As these were a late-season buy for me, I can only assume they?d do well in summer heat.  Judging by the thin dusting of salt from sweat evaporated on their surface even in October, I?d say they perform well to get sweat away from your skin and out in the air. 

My only gripe is the thick, pillowy feeling of the chamois.   It works exceptionally well; and externally, it doesn?t appear to be the thickness that it feels. I?ve grown accustomed to the thinner chamois of others.
review.name: Performance and comfort at a price.

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Long Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Just what you would expect to get from Assos& Premium and attention to detail. These bib shorts are fantastic. I couldn't ask for more from a bib short that replaced the Cento.
review.name: Cento replacement!

name: Mille GTO C2 Long Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: These seem great, but the XS was too small: I'm 5'4, about 117 lbs, and these are too tight in the waist and crotchy. I wish the S was in stock!
review.name: cute but too small!

review.reviewBody: Like it so far. Deep pockets in front are great. Minus a star because there's only one pocket in the back. Where did the other one go? I'm 5'4, 120 pounds, small tush and Xsm fits well.
review.name: Pretty good.

review.reviewBody: Hiking, climbing, running, road-tripping. The fabric (light but durable) and fit are great. The waistband is super comfy, even with a climbing harness. I own 3 pairs!
review.name: Favorite all purpose shorts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The shorts fit well (I'm 5'5" 140) and are super comfy. I especially like the soft waistband and pull-on style. I bought them for fieldwork on the water but I wear them all the time. I highly recommend them.
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: These for like a dream and can be dressed up or down. I love the black as they look classy and green for daily wear. I think the flat waist is flattering on the stomach and they're definitely my favorite shorts
review.name: My favorite shorts pls bring back next season

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] OR does it again. Stretchy, durable, moves with you, & doesn't ride up. Was hiking and sliding up and around on boulders with not a fre or tear.
review.name: Absolutely Amazing Shorts!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Stretchy! Comfortable shorts to wear hiking or for a baseball game on a hot summer day!
review.name: Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) I wear these everywhere. My thighs don't gobble these as I walk and I love them. I'm between sizes 5'2" 164 lbs and they are a bit loose, the zendo M pants are a tight but good fit.
review.name: I would buy again!

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) Great fit, nice wide waist band and very comfortable.
review.name: great short

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm a walker and I needed some lightweight shorts for the summer. These are a nice neutral green with three excellent pockets. I can put my phone in any of the pockets and it doesn't drag the shorts down. I also really like the waistband! Very soft and comfortable.
review.name: Comfy shorts

description: Buy the Shimano Ultegra RD-R8000 Rear Derailleur online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ultegra RD-R8000 Rear Derailleur
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano Ultegra RD-R8000 Rear Derailleur online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ultegra RD-R8000 Rear Derailleur
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano Ultegra RD-R8000 Rear Derailleur online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great rear mech at a great price.  Smooth and reliable with every shift.  Mine is a medium cage run with an Ultegra 12x25 11 speed cassette.  Replaced an older Dura Ace derailleur and cassette.  Unless you're racing (and maybe even if you are) this is a really good choice, imo.
review.name: Silkey smooth, very affordable.

review.reviewBody: I'm glad I purchased one of these, since it is well known news that Shimano is cutting back production of their manual drivetrain components
review.name: Hedge against the future

review.reviewBody:
Shimano Ultegra high quality, except the barrel adjuster is a flimsy plastic that will not consistently work.
I swapped in the adjuster from my old 10 speed ultegra and it works great now.  Alternatively you could add an inline adjuster someplace (if you don't have all internal cables :(. 
Shimano blew it on this one, but maybe they have changed the adjuster on newer versions of this model.
If you get one and it seems hard to get it shifting right, unless your derailleur hanger is off, it's probably not you, it is the adjuster to.
review.name: Great Derailleur, EXCEPT adjustment

review.reviewBody: Changed everything on an older 105 bike I had to all Ultegra. Well worth the investment. It takes a lot less movement on the shifters to make a gear change, and the change is faster and quieter. Rather than be limited to a 28 tooth low gear, now I can easily go to a 34. There's plenty of hills here where that'll make life easier. I use this particular bike on Zwift and hated the idea of yet another winter of climbing with a 28 tooth gear. (Why is it EVERY route but one on ZWIFT has a bunch of climbing?!)  I run 52/36 up front and really didn't want to change that where everything else I have uses that. I tried all the Wolf Tooth stuff to try and get a bigger cassette on, but no luck. It's so easy to put on a long cage derailleur I can't believe I waited this long. It wouldn't surprise me if you could put on an 11/36 1170 for even easier hill climbing. - If you could find one.
review.name: Big Step up from Old Short Cage 105

review.reviewBody: Just changed my mind about what kind of cassette I would need for an upcoming race. Great price and great customer service !
review.name: Great product

name: Ultegra RD-R8000 Rear Derailleur

description: Buy the Petzl NEOX Belay Device online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: NEOX Belay Device
hasVariant.description: Buy the Petzl NEOX Belay Device online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: NEOX Belay Device
hasVariant.description: Buy the Petzl NEOX Belay Device online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Good for new lead belayer and Always have a hand on the brake side of the rope.
review.name: neox

review.reviewBody: It does feed smoother if you do not hold the device while you belay. So you hold onto the break strand with hand and the climbers end with the other. But if you like to hold the device with your thumb and index finger and clasp the break strand with middle, ring and pinky finger than purchasing the neox does not make any sense. With this form of belay it does not feet any smoother. And taking up slack is somehow more difficult than with the grigri. And it’s heaver. And it’s not great for multipitch. One you can’t belay off of the anchor and with the added chores of multi-pitching…lets just say i like having the extra sense of security of the grigri.
review.name: I don’t like it

review.reviewBody: This device is sooooo sick. Lead belaying with the neox is SMOOTH AS BUTTER. It leaves virtually no chance of short roping your climber and still provides a quick catch when they whip. 10/10, 5 stars, Grade A+.. its seriously the best!
review.name: This is THE Belay Device

review.reviewBody: This belay device feels really good, its super smooth feeding rope to a lead climber. The future is now.
review.name: Straight upgrade from the GriGri

review.reviewBody: I LOVE this device. I cannot even explain to you how much of an improvement this device is for lead belaying over the traditional GriGri. I am a smaller woman and often am belaying someone over my height/weight, and the ability to feed without short roping is KEY. The device still catches like a beast AND you still have the control over lowering.  If you mostly lead climb/belay this device is a MUST.
review.name: THE device for lead climbing

review.reviewBody: The Neox is a phenomenal upgrade from the Grigri for lead belaying. The feeding is so smooth that you'd have to fight giving slack when the climber is clipping. Falls catch the exact same as the Grigri. I was worried that the lowering process would be too sensitive and I was pleasantly surprised with the friction. That being said, if you have a heavier climber, you will have to watch your lower a bit more than the grigri, but the difference wasn't huge like a Revo. Probably the one thing to take into consideration for buying this is that this device is really specialized for lead belaying on, generally, single pitches. My Grigri or Pinch is still preferred for a crew that might TR.
review.name: Best Lead Belaying Device

name: NEOX Belay Device
NEOX Belay Device

Buy the Helly Hansen Elevation Infinity 2.0 Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Elevation Infinity 2.0 Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Helly Hansen Elevation Infinity 2.0 Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Like many of the other reviews, the sizing is awful. First off, Backcountry sent me the wrong size (ordered a medium, got sent a large) and made me pay for the return! I have broader shoulders and the size large I did not order was too small in the shoulders without any layers on, though the jacket itself was huge everywhere else. I have an athletic build so I truly have no idea how this jacket could fit anyone. Super nice jacket and materials, although the sizing is terrible for a $700+ jacket. AND, the HH on the front is not black, it is orange, making the product photo wrong. Super disappointed with this purchase.
review.name: Jacket Issues

review.reviewBody: Super glad I bought this jacket for ski season.  I have the bright orange one.  On cold days, I add layers underneath.  It has perfect amount of pockets and its not super bulky.
review.name: Best ski jacket ever

review.reviewBody:
This is just a review on the size. The jacket is pretty good and you can read other more in-depth reviews for more on the quality and features. I ordered mine in off season so I can't speak for how good it will be on the slopes and in rough conditions. It seems pretty good from just putting it on around the house.
I ordered both the XXL and the XL sizes for the jacket. According to the sizing chart and online tech assistance I bought the XXL. I'm 6'2" 210lbs with an athletic build.  I'm in my 40s and keep active but I'm not a body builder/fitness fanatic by any means.  I was swimming in the XXL even though I matched up with the 47" chest size and longer arm for the XXL. It was huge in all areas. I'd say if you are 260lbs+ then it might be useful. I also use a spine/body armor chest protector and it was still huge with that on. Definitely more for the 6'4"+ and larger body types. The XL fit great for my size. Maybe still a little more than I would want around the midsection. I prefer a more tapered area there to help keep snow out and not feel like it's too baggy. Overall a much better fit but could be a little slimmer fit.  I did keep the XL and will write a new review in the winter to see how it actually works in the Utah cold winters. Hopefully I can get a good powder day, a snowy preseason day and a cold day to really test the limits.
review.name: Infinity 2.0 Jacket size issues

review.reviewBody: Writing this for reference to others.  This jacket seems like it would be amazing/bulletproof but unfortunately I had to return due to the fit.  I'm 5'11" ~210 (42" chest / 34" waist).  Ordered a Large.  Like some other HH stuff I've tried, the shoulders & chest fit well and are borderline tight - but the torso/bottom of the jacket is way to baggy/big for me.  Wanted to love the jacket but fit just wasn't right.  Hope this helps others.
review.name: 5 Stars for Quality But Fit is Not Ideal

review.reviewBody: I?ve been skiing around the globe for 40+ years, and having worked on mountain in Aspen, I?ve used every brand of technical kit you can imagine. This new line from Helly Hansen has raised the bar, period. Believe me, I?ve tried to find fault w/this jacket, but I?ve got to say, I?m REALLY impressed! Very thoughtful details - it?s clear HH is listening to the professionals, from pocket placement to sizing/articulation, cuffs, zippers, phone protection, int storage, Recco, lift pass accessibility, venting, fabric durability, sustainability, etc? especially love the fluorescent orange detail on the hood - great safety feature! From the moment you lay your hands on this shell, you will def realize that this is a piece of serious technical gear? w/the price to match!
review.name: BEST SHELL I?VE EVER OWNED!!!

review.reviewBody: Purchased as a gift. Nice quality jacket, just didn?t like the orange color which was more neon orange than in photo.
review.name: Bella

name: Elevation Infinity 2.0 Jacket - Men's
