review.reviewBody: These gloves have become my go to over several months of pretty hard use. Less padding than I usually go for, but I think that is a plus. They are very breathable, offer good grip on the bars, don't bunch up, don't shift around or rub, don't pinch between the fingers, they just disappear as you ride, which is perfect. The Medium is true to size, as I wear a medium in several other brands as well. They've held up well over 1500+ miles and lots of washes. Definitely recommend!
review.name: Great minimalist glove

review.reviewBody: I usually wear a large and I couln't even get my hand in these, extremely small for a large.

review.reviewBody: I ordered this sweater as a Christmas gift for my 5'9" 40-year old son who is an endurance athlete and climber and who has worn a men's medium since his 20's, including many products from Smartwool. I could see the second I removed the packaging that this sweater was grossly mis-sized, in fact, I had my 6'5" 225 lb husband who normally wears an XL try it on and it fit him. I'm more than a little annoyed that after the many high-end gear purchases I've made from Backcountry over the years, I have to pay to return what is basically a defective product.
review.name: Sizing is Waaaay Off!! Don't buy.

review.reviewBody: I ordered these for my mom two years ago and loved them. So, I ordered a pair for myself this year. Unfortunately, they have changed the design. They are still comfortable, but are smaller than they were (I comfortably fit into my mom's 8 from two years ago, and had to order an 8.5 which are snug). The ankle is tight and rubs against my calf. I loved the older version that was a wider ankle! So that's a bit disappointing. They look nice and are waterproof which is a big plus, so I still plan on keeping them.
review.name: Good, but not the same
comment: Hello arc, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our EMELIE™ III Women's Waterproof Chelsea Bootie is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Love these little boots, they’re waterproof and perfect for everything but deep snow. Love ‘em!
review.name: Best cute boots in water and light snow!

review.reviewBody: Really cute and VERY comfortable but a little masculine in a 10.5 😊
review.name: Like em

review.reviewBody: Very disappointed in condition of boots I received. Many scratches/imperfections; appeared worn. Terrible return process. Took over 1 month for refund after repeated calls/emails.
review.name: Received damaged boots

review.reviewBody: So disappointed. These are sized so small. I am a solid size 10 in everything and I couldn't even walk the length of these was so "off". Gorgeous color and I can see they'd be comfortable if they were sized accurately but these are a big miss. Fairly narrow as well but this could be misleading because my toes couldn't even flatten.
review.name: Sized terribly small
comment: Hello jenzzzzzzz, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our EMELIE™ III Women's Waterproof Chelsea Bootie is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Any recommendations on how to stop the noise they make when walking on bare flooring (tile, wood, LVP)… they are loud and squeaky!  I love this boot, they are comfortable, they are cute and true to size!  But the loud sound they make, I don’t know what I’m gonna do because that’s a pretty critical factor when wearing shoes.
review.name: Loud when walking
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.reviewBody: These EMELIE III Waterproof Boots are so comfortable. The fit is perfect and they look great on my larger than average feet (size 11). Major is a medium olive color suede with Gum (tan) sole. These boots will get good use when the weather gets a bit colder. I cannot speak to the waterproof claim yet but in my experience owning several pairs of Sorel boots and shoes that are waterproof, I have no worries they will perform well in wet weather conditions.
review.name: Love these boots!

review.reviewBody: I love these boots. Lighter than my Blundstones and comfy to work in. Second pair I’ve purchased.  I feel like I’m a true size 9M and they fit perfect.
review.name: Comfy

review.reviewBody: I love these booties!! They fit perfectly and am so happy with them. To top it off they are waterproof and I live where it is really rainy!!
review.name: LOVE THESE!!

review.reviewBody: Very disappointed, this is the second pair of these I have purchased and they changes them. They are now more snug and the seam across the top makes wearing them painful. I had hoped to break them in but but that may be too painful to do because of the seam. Unfortunately I have worn them and can’t return per their policy. They are cute though.
review.name: Painful to wear
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

name: Emelie III WP Chelsea - Women's

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The watercell is my constant companion when hiking or hunting. It's soft construction helps it slide into a backpack easily and as you use the water or if you only semi filled it to begin with it only takes up the space of the water it holds.
The exterior is a rigid and durable material and has held up to being dropped onto rocks, brambles and all other manner of potential punctures flawlessly.
 I started with the 6L but have moved to the 4L unless it's scorching out. The 6L now lives in my truck for refills/emergencies.
review.name: The watercell is my constant

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I can't think of a thing I would change for this water storage bag. It works perfectly.
review.name: Watercell X is fantastic

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use the 6 liter version and carry it on my motorcycle when I camp.
review.name: Excellent way to transport water on a motorcycle

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the tent we purchased. Great design, so many thoughtful features! We also love this gravity water filter. Great for base camping.
review.name: Amazing product quality and engineering

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ordered 3, 2 came with pinhole leaks. Given that, I didn’t trust replacements and I asked for a refund. They did so without a problem, but 2/3 having leaks to start also leaves me with little confidence in the third. 

I do think the shape and design makes them easier to use, and dry out afterwards, than the msr dromedary bags, so was sad to see their poorer quality.
review.name: 2/3 came with leaks

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great water tank. This is my 2nd watercell for longer overland trips.
review.name: Great water tank!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just love how it collapses when empty. It durable and well built.
review.name: Packable water tank

review.reviewBody:
Great product - low profile and I like the variety of sizes. The shower head attachment comes slid onto one of the straps. It is easy to take off and use but two things to keep in mind (and that kept me from a 5-star review)
1. Make sure you stash the other cap someplace you won't lose it - it does not attach to the carrying straps
2. If you want to put the shower head attachment back onto the carrying straps, it is not at all easy to do. It's like they made the attachment to perfectly fit onto the straps but not any extra room to make it easy to put back into its storage spot.
review.name: Shower Head Attachment

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] perfect for those dry campsites - hard to beat - durable
review.name: perfect for those dry campsites

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great addition to a backpacking trip - worked well, appreciate the durability of the material!
review.name: Watercell

name: Watercell X Reservoir

description: Buy the Hydrapak Flux+ 1.5L Water Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Flux+ 1.5L Water Bottle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Hydrapak Flux+ 1.5L Water Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Second order, love all of the products so far. This one is to replace the 1l beefree bottle because it is more resilient and durable. I do long distance trail runs and this fills up my bottles and gives me the reserve I need until the next stop. Have dropped it several times and it hasn’t broken yet.
review.name: Get bottle

review.reviewBody: I bought this to fill my hydra pack bladder in the Grand Canyon when the water is turned off. It does not improve the taste of the water. The filter works well to fill this then squeeze into the bladder. Also, the filter fits my wide mouth Hydra Flask hand held and I can drink straight from it. For the hand held conversion it seeps a little as it bounces. Remember that this functions when you squeeze it as promised in the description. I found this a more affordable option than other brands like Salomon. I will be taking this on all my back country runs as a backup from now on.
review.name: Works Well In The Wild

review.reviewBody: great product. easily refillable at lake and stream. Squeezy bottle has held up so far A+
review.name: took this on a hiking trip

review.reviewBody: I've used this for days of bike camping.  So far it's been great. very fast flow and easy to fill and store
review.name: Very good so far

review.reviewBody: Rigid oval top shape tales up extra space while compressed, which is undesirable. It helps keep it open for filling with water, but I would prefer a more collapsible design. Primary use to squeeze water into other containers.
review.name: Excessive rigid structure
comment:
Hi Mike,

Thank you for your feedback! We are happy to hear you are enjoying our Flux+ Bottle. If you are looking for a more collapsible structure + filtration, I would recommend our Seeker+ 6L, it includes a Plug N Play top cap where our 28mm Filter fits in and a camp tap to dispense filtered water for hand washing, food etc., or to refill another vessle. Since the filter is not built into the cap, it can roll up when empty to reserve space.
Please see the link below for more details. 
https://hydrapak.com/products/seeker%E2%84%A2-6-l-2?variant=44292644897001

I hope this helps and thank you again for the feedback!

review.reviewBody: Easy to use. Filters well with great flow. Durable and packable. I love it
review.name: Flux 1.5

review.reviewBody: Works as it should, packs well.  I just wish the flask lid was included and not an accessory.  Works great for bike packing and for any other type of adventure.
review.name: Neato squishy vessel

review.reviewBody: Best filtration bottle I’ve owned. Use this bad boy all the time now.
Bikepacking and been using this filter for a month straight. Absolutely love it. Awesome size, love the handle and stands up by itself most of the time!
review.name: Stoked

review.reviewBody: goo item, great quality, versatile design, suitable for daily use, I love it and bring it everywhere.
review.name: goo item, great quality, versatile design

name: Flux+ 1.5L Water Bottle

review.reviewBody: Very warm and super soft. This coat highly exceeded my expectations.
review.name: Amazing jacket

review.reviewBody: First cold snap and snow of the season at 8000 feet in elevation. Ran errands and the fleece blocked the wind and  was warm and stylish. No interior pockets. Used exterior char pockets for my phone. A bit stiff and boxy feeling right out of the bag, seems to be loosening up  after one week.
review.name: Warner than Expected looks classy.

review.reviewBody: I wanted something to wear at home during the long winter months that was less dumpy than my dark colored hoodie. At half price, this was perfect- pretty colors, flattering shape and warm. I scored!
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: Very happy with this purchase. I got the teal and it's a gorgeous color, complimented with this rose/light maroon trim. Also cuts the wind excellently, I am set for hiking. I saw a review that mentioned it had a bad lining/they didn't like it. I was nervous about purchasing because of this, but I'm actually pretty indifferent to it. It's not rough, it's just not shearling or anything like that. The inner lining if anything just makes for very easy removal and it's easy to slide into. Perfect for an active lifestyle on chillier days.
review.name: Warm, functional, and beautiful color

review.reviewBody: I've had this jacket for over a year now and still wear it often, so I'm happy I got it. This said, it may not fit you and your needs. This jacket has a weight to it and is more rigid than a fleece sweater. The outside is fluffy but the inside is made of what appears to be some kind of wind proof material. I don't mind it as I don't wear this jacket naked, so that rigid material doesn't bother me. Also, I'd size down as the jacket is a bit oversized. Hope this helps!
review.name: Read this before purchasing

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love this jacket. The color is beautiful the quality of the fabric great but as someone else said the arms are really really long!  The jackets is also very stiff. I’m returning it without wearing.
review.name: Wanted to ❤️ it!

review.reviewBody: This is the warmest jacket I have ever owned.  I love the fit and I can wear it in 5 degree weather and I am still warm.  I would like another one in another color.  It’s roomy so if I want a heavy sweater I can wear it under it.  I think it’s the wonderful.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: This is a well made jacket and the color I purchased (dark natural) was very nice. When I tried the jacket on, I loved the weight and feel of it. The only problem (and the biggest one) is that it makes me look a bit bigger than my size so wasn't very flattering to my shape. I felt like I resembled a cute koala bear while wearing it. Perhaps I should have purchased a smaller size (purchased large; I usually wear size 12 US jackets/coats) but I wanted the extra room for larger sweaters. Sadly the jacket (along with the matching quarter zip pullover I purchased for layering) have to go back. I really wanted to like this jacket but in the end it was a "No" for me.
review.name: Really loved the jacket but...

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love this but...  the arms are really really long.  Love the color, the fabric, the pocket.  I returned it.
review.name: Love it But...

review.reviewBody:
I can wear just a base layer with the jacket for rides (35-45 degrees) and be very comfortable. The lining really helps to regulate heat and sweat including sleeve of the jacket. When I wear a base layer do not feel significant  temperature difference on my back. 
The pockets are deep enough for a wind jacket-for the downhills.
Do recommend a neck gaiter.                                                                                                      
The size chart recommendations seem to be spot on.  I sized up to accommodate for a thicker base layer when the temperature and/or windchill are 30 degrees. It is great to have more time riding instead of stopping to remove or put on a layer or arm warmers for the varying temperatures.
review.name: Great piece of Winter'/Early Spring Kit

Thank You 
Meese.

review.itemreviewed: Quest Element GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love Solomon boots. I have worn all types of cross trainers and boots for hiking especially purchasing ones with waterproofing. 
I have found that Solomon has decreased in quality of workmanship and waterproofing. Although I love these boots and bought in April 2023 (on sale) I just started wearing them in September of 2024. After each hike, I washed them (with just water) to make sure all dirt was off seams, dried with a towel. The front toe kick part , where the rubber is glued to the leather is already showing signs of breaking apart. This is really a disappointment as my previous Solomon would last for years! What is happening to this great shoe company? I will have to do a return on these awesome boots. I like the look and feel, they give great ankle support and are somewhat waterproof. Not totally waterproof as water is penetrating through their gore Tex liner. 
I would be careful about ordering this
Boot if you expect high quality products .
review.name: Comfortable but lacking workmanship
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Quest Element GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my 6th pair of Salomon fit and finish not as nice as any of my previous pairs. Always order size 11 and usually fit like a glove these are lose all around my foot and if you try to tighten with shoe laces they bunch up and look ill fitted . I should have sent back right away but gave them a week to see if they would feel better upon a break in period . they did not so pretty disappointed to say the least
review.name: Not my favorite
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: Quest Element GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have arch trouble because of my job these boots let me work full time and my feet get better each day ! Full time farrier !
review.name: Great boot my 3 pair.

review.reviewBody: Amazing value for money and I don’t leave home without them

review.itemreviewed: Quest Element GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: My feet apparently have gotten larger and my Scarpas are now too short. My new Salamon Quest Elements are lighter, supportive and with plenty of width in the toes. The soles give good traction and protection.
review.name: New boots!

review.itemreviewed: Quest Element GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I take very good care of my Quests, have put close to 1000kms on these babies.  Those soles have held up well but are now almost worn flat.  My only complaint is that they're not quite wide enough for my feet.  Can these be re-soled?
review.name: I love these.

review.itemreviewed: Quest Element GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are marketed as a hiking boot, but I use them as winter boots. My climate ranges from extremely slushy to icy in a matter of hours, and these boots provide the stability and grip that I need for my 5km daily commute. A little bit of a hassle to put on and take off compared to my blundstones, but the trade off in terms of quality is well worth it.
review.name: Reliable boots in the thick of winter

review.itemreviewed: Quest Element GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Ive been wearing the Salomon Ultra Treks but for unknown reasons they are not sold in the U.S anymore or for the time being. The Elements are a great second options. They are very light compared to the Forces options and comfortable while providing awesome stability and ankle protection. I ordered the black/olive color and they look great. Wish they had a black on black options but not a big deal. Hiking around on these boots as my daily work boot really saves my feet from fatigue and wear. When i have to run in them they are light enough to not affect my speed or stride. I in my early 40's and had knee surgery a couple years ago so the cushion on these elements are perfect relief from the shock cause slips, running, hops down a mountain. I have recommended these to various coworkers and they love them too. At the end of a long work day the comfort makes a difference and alleviates fatigue compared to other name brands such as Lowas. Merrell srongfileds are okay but they are heavy like brinks. My work terrain is so harsh that these boots usually last me from 6-8 months before the break down. Breakdown areas for me are always on the inside of the boot towards the rear. The stitching comes apart and the elements start making its way in. But overall, best boot I have. Along with the Ultra Trek amd boot the Quest prime which i believe these elements are an update to as well as various Forces from mids tops to the very expensive models. I think ill stick to these until the X- Ultra trek comes back. Those are awesome and although high tops they feel like running shoes. True to size I would say. I always go 1/2 size bigger because I double up socks. I get blisters from so much hiking and running.
review.name: Best Salomon boot for work

review.itemreviewed: Quest Element GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this for my husband,  he absolutely loved it!!!
review.name: Hiking boots/solomon

review.itemreviewed: Quest Element GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Replacing a pair of Solomon quest bought these about a month ago happy so far they are wet almost daily. No leaks so far fairly comfortable. I would give them at least a day or 10 mile break in. Before I did a serious hike in them.
review.name: Good so far.

name: Quest Element GTX Hiking Boot - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Prowler Pro Sticky Rubber Wading Boot
review.reviewBody: Bought these prior to a 2 week trip to Alaska. I wore them all day for 8 days without any issues - they performed fantastic. During the trip I often hiked 3 to 4 miles in and out of the water with no issues. In the water they were stable and provided good traction and support. Out of the water they were comfortable and easy to hike in. I highly recommend these boots.
review.name: Alaska was no match!

review.itemreviewed: Prowler Pro Sticky Rubber Wading Boot
review.reviewBody:
I bought a pair of size 11 Prowler Pro Sticky wading boots for my son for his birthday. They looked like decent boots, and he said the fit was great with plenty of room and comfort. He is 5'10" and just about 130 lbs. "Great," I thought to myself, I hit a home-run with this purchase. Third time on the stream, we prepare to wader-up and my son shows me his boot. The side wall is already blown-out. I noticed the poor stitching is extremely insufficient for the (lack of) durability of the material.  
With only hours in his boots,  in no way should they have failed like this. Now, they can't be returned! I've had wading boots for over 3-4 seasons with no sidewall failure. Usually the soles of the boots begin to peel warranting a new pair. Just plain shoddy/cheap assembly. This was very frustrating. I have lost faith with Redington and will no longer be purchasing Redington products.
review.name: Total Junk!

review.itemreviewed: Prowler Pro Sticky Rubber Wading Boot
review.reviewBody: I'll report back after putting these to good use, but wanted to write a quick note to caution against sizing-up. I found conflicting info about how Redington sizes their boots -- you should buy your actual foot size, even if you're wearing stocking-foot waders or neoprene wading socks. These are built with a bunch of extra room. I wear mondo 27 ski boots (US Men's size 9) and Redington's size 9 is plenty large for me to use with stocking-foot waders and/or neoprene wading socks. If you go up a size, they'll probably be too huge. I'm initially impressed with how light these are. Much lighter than the Korkers they're replacing. I'll leave it at that for now.
review.name: Nice and light, but don't size up...

name: Prowler Pro Sticky Rubber Wading Boot

hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Swift 22L H2O Hydration Pack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’ve had several different day packs but have yet to find “the perfect one”. So far this is by far the closest! It is a good size and I love that the pockets on the hip belt are actually large enough to be useable. It is nice to have one mesh side pocket and one that zips up. The water bladder far exceeds the design of a Camelbak. The blue interior is great- it is nice to be able to see inside rather than a black interior. If I could change anything I would like a little more organization in the main pocket- like a key ring or side pockets inside, but overall it is a very nice design.
review.name: Perfect size and comfortable day pack

review.reviewBody: Gorgeous comfortable pack. This color! Dark jade green. So beautiful.
review.name: Gorgeous pack

review.reviewBody: Great pack with all the pockets and space a daypack needs. Deducting a star here because of the side mesh netting: the very first time I went out on a hike with this bag I used a hydroflask bottle in it and the simple act of taking it in and out over one day has caused a couple tears in it. For a product that has a lifetime guarantee (a hallmark of longevity) it seemed peculiar that this should happen. I have two other Gregory packs and both are incredible...so it seems an anomaly that this should happen. I will need to put that guarantee to the test on this occasion and see what can be done.
review.name: Overall solid, but some materials could be better

review.reviewBody:
Overall I love this backpack. The 2L hydration pouch has been perfect to get through most days of use. The bag has worked well as a carry-on as well as for day time outings. 
My only complaint is at 5'6" I find the bag a bit narrow for my frame.
review.name: Very functional bag, runs narrow.

review.reviewBody: This has quickly become my absolute favorite hiking pack. From someone who loves to pack extra layers, snacks, and have plenty of water, the amount of space in this pack is perfect. Not too big, not too small, just right. 10/10 would buy again!
review.name: The perfect hiking day pack

review.reviewBody: Loaded with features and fits great. Only recommendation would be to add strap keepers.

I have not used the pack yet but it's size and structure are hard to find.  I need a pack that will fit under an airplane seat with maximum capacity for traveling and comfortably get me hiking for two days(personal belongings and water, no tent or sleeping bag).  This pack has a nice hip belt with roomy zip pockets, a large water bladder and hose system, roomy storage that can be cinched down to reduce size to fit under airplane seat or to keep what you pack from bouncing around while hiking, along with numerous additional features.  Bonus the color is attractive.  The real test comes in 3wks
review.name: Multi purpose pack

review.reviewBody: It does everything I need it to. I have used this item as a small day pack for a few trips. I the space was more than enough for what I needed it to do for simple day hikes and climbing trips.

I would like have given a five since this is a really nice bag, well designed, light weighted and very supportive, but unfortunately the hanger does work with my existing camelbak water reservoir when I tried to use it as a backup. Actually all my other Gregory bags (Deva and Jade) have the same problem. I would appreciate if Gregory could just make the hanger slightly narrower to be compatible with other major brands.
review.name: Got everything for my dayhike need

review.reviewBody: I bought this product in June and it has so many great features.  The straps fit my body (I'm female) snugly, the pockets on the hip belt are useful without being too bulky, and the laces on the back are adjustable.  The Gregory 3D bladder is the best on the market.  I was in love with this day pack.  Then I started using it, and discovered one problem.  The back of the pack is constructed with raised sections, presumably to increase airflow.  It was like hiking with a washboard on my back.  It was super uncomfortable.  On long hikes, my back went a little numb.  Ultimately I returned the pack.  Very sad to see it go, because otherwise it is one of the best ones I have used.  I did buy a Gregory bladder, though, because they are great.
review.name: Many great features, one big problem

name: Swift 22L H2O Hydration Pack - Women's
